description:
The APP NAME web application fails to perform server-side authorisation checks when directly referencing various objects, allowing unuauthorised access to other users' configuration and report data.

A direct object reference occurs when a reference to an object (such as a file or key) is included as a URL or a parameter and used in an HTTP request by the server to return the relevant data for the requested object. Direct object references used in this way, like all client-side parameters, can be manipulated to access arbitrary objects if verification of a user's privileges is not performed prior to returning the requested object.

The following requests were vulnerable to Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) - this list may not be exhaustive:
MENTION THE AFFECTED URL/TARGET
